trans-unit.source: Indicates that a class or property has a deferred load usage for XAML (such as a template behavior), and reports the class that enables the deferring behavior and its destination/content type.
<xref:System.Xaml.XamlDeferringLoader> is possibly involved in defer load scenarios as a support class.
WPF Usage Notes
An example class where this attribute is applied in the WPF XAML implementation is <xref:System.Windows.TemplateContent>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XamlDeferLoadAttribute"></xref> class, using string names of types.
The string name of the type for the implementation to use for the defer load behavior.
The string name of the type for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
loaderType or contentType is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XamlDeferLoadAttribute"></xref> class, using CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> values.
The CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the implementation to use for the defer load behavior.
The CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
loaderType or contentType is `null`.
Gets the CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
The CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
Gets the string name of the type for the implementation to use for the defer load behavior.
The string name of the type for the converter to use for the defer load behavior.
Gets the CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the implementation to use for the defer load behavior.
The CLR <xref href="System.Type"></xref> value for the implementation to use for the defer load behavior.
Gets the string name of the type for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
The string name of the type for the destination/content type of the defer load behavior.
